Governance and Business Process Officer

Company Name Deakin University Company Location Geelong, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 174 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


JOB ID: 180694
SALARY RANGE: $78,117 to $84,361 pa (plus 17% super)
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full-time (36.75 hours per week) and continuing
LOCATION: Geelong Waurn Ponds Campus

ABOUT THE ROLE

In this role you will provide principal Business Process Management (BPM) system support for the Facilities Services Division as well as providing high level project and administrative assistance.

This will include:

  • Developing and maintaining the Facilities Services Business Process Management (BPM) system and practices contributing to the achievement of the Division's objectives.
  • Facilitating business improvement opportunities to streamline workflows, reduce paper based forms and increase the utilisation of the Business Process System.
  • Undertaking key administrative tasks that support the Strategic Asset Management Group to effectively deliver services to the University.
  • Providing operational support to the University's annual participation in the TEFMA Benchmarking collection.



ABOUT YOU

  • A degree with subsequent relevant experience OR extensive experience and expertise in administrative fields or appropriate qualifications in business management and/or administration.
  • Demonstrated experience of governance administration and policy frameworks in a large organisations.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently within a diverse work environment.
  • High-level analytical skills, accuracy and attention to detail including the ability to comprehend and analyse business process documentation.


For a full list of the selection criteria please see the position description


CONTACT FOR FURTHER INFORMATION: Jo Riley, Tel: +61 3 5227 8616

CLOSING DATE: Sunday 16 September 2018


We value our staff and understand that they are more than just their jobs, that's why we offer benefits that enhance work life. Further information on Deakin's workplace benefits can be found here: deakin.edu.au/about-deakin/work-at-deakin/why-work-at-deakin/staff-benefits

TO APPLY

For a full copy of the position description and to apply online, please visit deakin.edu.au/about-deakin/work-at-deakin

Deakin University values diversity, enables access and promotes inclusion.

Deakin University is an employer of choice for women and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Salesforce Solution Architect

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 66 views

Job description

An exciting opportunity exists for a Salesforce Solution Architect to join a progressive and growing team. \xa0


  • Salesforce Solution Architect
  • Permanent Opportunity, exciting time of transformation!
  • South East suburbs\xa0


Are you an experienced Salesforce Solution Architect and looking for your next opportunity? \xa0

Have you worked in an agile environment and like a challenge? \xa0

Do you like working with a supportive team that values professional growth? \xa0

Then look no further, we have the opportunity for you! \xa0

Our client is a well-known service provider that is rapidly growing. They operate in a growth-orientated, agile and progressive environment that fosters innovation and rewards success. \xa0

The role will see you building a complete view of a solution for a project within a business domain (including, processes, information and information technology asset) from conception to implementation, ensuring that the solution meets the requirements and is aligned with the over-arching technology strategy and enterprise architecture guidelines/standards.

As a Salesforce Solution Architect you will be working (but not limited to) the following: \xa0

  • Developing and maintaining target state solution architectures and roadmaps
  • Undertaking high level research, horizon scanning and analysis to identify future ICT trends, and assess applicability
  • Maintaining currency with industry best practice to ensure ICT solutions are fit for purpose
  • Developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders to align strategies with business needs
  • Overseeing the technical direction, development, and implementation of SFDC software solutions

\xa0To be successful for this role, you will need (but not limited to) the following:


  • Proven functional/technical professional with multiple full lifecycle SFDC implementations and at least 3+ years of experience working with SFDC
  • Direct experience with SFDC Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Service Cloud (application design, architecture and development using Salesforce.com), certified a MAJOR PLUS
  • Excellent understanding of current architectural design patterns, standards, technologies and techniques
  • Strong SFDC knowledge and Integration components for SFDC (for example, SFDC APIs, Apex controllers, Apex Web Services, Apex callout, outbound messaging, SFDC data loaders and Tools - e.g. Mulesoft)
  • Demonstrated in-depth knowledge of leading edge technologies and plans for the future of a technology and/or applications area
  • Strong knowledge of AGILE/SCRUM Processes
  • Effectively work with management, on-site/off-site development staff to accomplish SFDC project deliverables


Sound exciting? To learn more, apply now and take the next step in your career.

Senior Security Engineer

Company Name illion Australia and New Zealand Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 212 views

Job description

About the Role

An opportunity has become available for a permanent Senior Security Engineer to join the team at illion. The Senior Security Engineer is responsible for the smooth running of the Illion security infrastructure, associated services and security projects whilst ensuring IT security procedures and documented and repeatable and that policies are implemented and adhered to as laid out by the IT Security team.


You will be responsible for:

  • The role is responsible for the provision of technical expertise across the enterprise, including maintaining network availability and security and performance across DBA's network system, by resolving network and security related issues to meet SLAs.
  • Deliver operational effectiveness and documented processes for the End Point DLP, Password Access Management, BeyondTrust, WAF, Voice/Data networks and other environments and resolve problems across the infrastructure including network, servers, telephony, desktop and security service.
  • Accurate Reporting of weekly and monthly performance metrics across the Illion security posture is essential to this role.


About You

The ideal candidate will have the following skills:

  • Planning and management capability, including project management core disciplines
  • Experience with security & network technologies such as Firewalls, Routers, Switches etc
  • Hands on experience with management of IT Security Operations and development of team capabilities
  • End to end Infrastructure and App Dev management experience, in large, complex enterprises
  • Exposure to IT Security Projects
  • Effective leadership, coordination, negotiation and dispute resolution skills
  • Exceptional stakeholder engagement skills including strong influencing and relationship skills and the ability to liaise and partner closely with internal business unit leaders
  • Strong influencing, relationship and negotiating skills, with the ability to liaise across the business and with external industry stakeholders
  • Flexible, responsive and ability to lead and manage change
  • Demonstrable commercial acumen
  • Exceptional verbal and written business communication skills
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Ability to multi-task, co-ordinate project activities, prioritise and meet deadlines
  • Strong commercial acumen
  • Track record of successful performance in an intense and dynamic environment Exposure to WAF & SIEM an advantage
  • High Level of exposure with large, complex voice and data networks


The ideal candidate will have the following experience:

  • High level of experience with Security & Networking technologies
  • Experience in configuring and managing Cisco & Checkpoint firewalls, Cisco Router ACL's, configuring and managing Cisco & Checkpoint VPN protocols and Technologies.
  • Strong knowledge on Microsoft Server technologies, IIS, TCP/IP & WAN and Internet Technologies.
  • Strong Network fault analysis and diagnostic skills (Packet analysis, Syslog, Firewall logs)
  • Certification Requirements (minimum)
  • Cisco Certified Network Administrator (CCNA)
  • Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP)
  • Eligibility to hold Australian Government Baseline Security Clearance
  • Experience in an IT Security function within the financial services industry and a knowledge of products associated with credit reporting, collections and marketing services
  • Knowledge of ISO 27001, IRAP, PCI-DSS and other associated standards
  • \xa0'Hands on' application of core Project Management competencies
  • PMBoK/PMP/PRINCE2/AGILE/Waterfall qualification or similar qualification
  • Worked within technology driven by Agile and Waterfall software development methodologies
  • Experience in running stand ups and using Kan Ban methodology to manage workflows
  • Superb Microsoft Office skills particularly Excel, Word, Powerpoint and Project
  • Familiarity with JIRA and Confluence
  • Tertiary degree in Business or Computer Science would be well regarded.

Job description

The Company\xa0

Heartscope Victoria, a leading healthcare provider who takes great pride in their technical support and medical solutions, is currently looking for a Cardiologist to consults at it's various service centres.

A market leader in cardiac medical diagnostic & consulting service who has steadily increased market share over the last twelve years.

We provide a comprehensive range of consulting cardiology services\xa0and procedures across the broad range of cardiac investigations\xa0including:

  • Echocardiography
  • Stress Echocardiography
  • Dobutamine Stress Echocardiography
  • CT Coronary Angiograms (CTCA)
  • ECGs
  • 24-hour Holter ECG Monitors
  • 24-hour ABP blood pressure monitors
  • In-hospital cardiac services such as Coronary Angiograms\xa0


Website:\xa0http://heartscope.com.au\xa0


The Role\xa0

We are currently looking for a Consultant Cardiologist to join our team\xa0 in Melbourne providing patient consulting services. There would also be\xa0 reporting work on cardiac tests as well as the supervision of Stress Echos performed at our various sites.\xa0\xa0


Position Details\xa0

This is an independent contract position.


Working hours are flexible, and will be set by mutual agreement.

The successful cardiologist will be responsible for ensuring high quality Cardiology Consulting services to our patients.

Promotion of your services to targeted medical practioners will be undertaken by the company.

All the required facilities, reception and administration services will be provided by the company.\xa0\xa0


To be successful in applying for this position you must hold an FRACP or DM cardiology or an equivalent qualification with substantial experience after attaining the qualifications and be eligible for registration with the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency.

[

Office Manager/HR Administrator (APAC)

Company Name Wrike Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 303 views

Job description

Wrike is a work management platform that is transforming the way people work and collaborate. We are focused on top-notch engineering, design, usability and dedicated customer care with a diversified international customer base of 16,000 and growing daily.


Our mission is to make teams insanely productive and we're guided by our core values to Grow, Execute and Collaborate. While we’re scaling quickly (over 600 Wrikers across the globe), we work hard to recruit the right teammates who share the same core values, know how to get things done, and add to an awesome culture.


Wrike is opening a new office in Melbourne, Australia and we are looking for an Office Manager who understands the importance of process and procedure, but appreciates a start-up environment. The perfect person will be passionate about company culture, and making Wrike an amazing place to work for all of our teams. You will be a key piece to our People Operations puzzle and you will support our international HR team with administrative projects keeping all the wheels turning behind the scenes at Wrike Australia.


Are you passionate about employee experience, and keen to learn more about HR and Recruitment? If your answers are yes - please read on!


About the Role: On a day to day basis you will partner directly with our International HR Manager & the People Operations team to optimize employee experience and help define what it means to be a Wriker! (Job responsibilities may vary)

(HR)

  • Update internal databases new employee information, contact details and employment forms
  • Prepare HR-related reports and analytics as needed
  • Address employee queries about benefits
  • Assist with employee orientation processes.

(Talent)

  • Help organize and streamline reporting within our Applicant Tracking System - Greenhouse
  • Assist in scheduling and confirming interviews with candidates across EMEA
  • Assist with internal job board, careers page and external posting strategy and management
  • Create, implement and manage social network calendar in order to support talent branding

(Workplace Operations)

  • Manage shipping, postage and stationary stock.
  • Assist with company culture events (low key & larger logistics)
  • Oversee and administer snack vendor and stock.
  • Manage company merchandise and supply.
  • Travel coordination - Airbnb, Uber, Visas & Invitation Letters (visas)
  • Low key events: birthdays, congratulatory gifts & celebrations, client onsites
  • Communications with building management & ensuring provision of access (fobs, car park remotes)


A strong candidate for this role looks like this:

  • Minimum of 2 years Office Manager or HR admin related experience
  • Strong at building relationships with stakeholders (at manager and employee level)
  • Are resourceful and self-directed; this role requires a highly competent and driven individual to get the ball rolling quickly
  • Proven ability to handle multiple tasks with little or no supervision
  • Ability to wear many hats on a day to day basis.
  • An extremely high sense of urgency and ability to work in fast-paced, ever-changing environment.
  • A natural born problem solver who enjoys the chaos of startup life.


In exchange for your efforts, we will offer the following;

  • Competitive compensation package.
  • Free catered lunch every day plus unlimited drinks and snacks
  • Company sponsored events
  • Flexible working conditions and working from home options

851100710:
[

Teacher Domestic Projects – Mechanical (Engineering)

Company Name Chisholm Institute Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 65 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Full time (1.0), Fixed Term Contract for upto 2 years
  • Salary Range: $53,431 - $85,613 p.a plus superannuation
  • Location: Dandenong Campus


About Us

Chisholm is Victoria’s premier public vocational education and training provider, with campuses located across Melbourne and the south east.

Each year, we welcome some 30,000 students from over 43 culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. More than 1,200 passionate and dedicated Chisholm employees work together to deliver quality training and education in Melbourne’s south east manufacturing heartland and key residential growth corridor.

A Victorian Government-owned TAFE, we aim to lead the way in education and training to inspire success and transform lives.

Our purpose is to excel in education and training and be respected and valued for enhancing the social and economic futures of individuals, industry and communities.

Our drive for commercial success is underpinned by our core values of Opportunity, Integrity, Collaboration, and Achievement.

In the past 20 years, we have grown significantly to become a multi-sector institute, delivering a broad range of education and training programs and services in higher education, vocational education and training (VET) and school sectors across ten campuses in Victoria, online, in the workplace and overseas with partner educational and government organisations.

We offer nearly 500 courses, from VCE/VCAL/VETiS, through to nationally accredited qualifications such as certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas, degrees, graduate certificates, graduate diplomas and short courses.

About The Role

The Teacher Engineering provides professional teaching and vocational expertise, across all aspects of domestic projects; delivery, planning and performance to ensure excellent outcomes for learners, the organisations that employ them and the communities they serve.

This position focuses on excellence in learner support, teaching delivery and learning assessment, resource development and educational administration.

The incumbent is a key and active participant of the Engineering & Electrotechnology (EE) business area and works to promote educational excellence, business growth and student centred services for the EE team.

Your Key Accountabilities Will Be To
  • Plan education practices and delivery sessions that reflect the most effective way to engage learners
  • Develop and deliver planned teaching sessions in a variety of innovative and adaptive ways, using technology, including Moodle, to engage learners and meet their needs and learning styles
  • Improve the quality of teaching and learning through a student based approach and adaptive curriculum
  • Ensure high quality and current resources, teaching materials and assessments are used in teaching and learning activities
  • Enhance the student experience to improve engagement early on and assist learners to interact with their academic and social environment to prevent attrition and encourage success
  • Engage with employers and industry representatives to ensure teaching materials and content meet industry and employer needs and are current


About You

You will have relevant tertiary qualifications in:
  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment (TAE40110)
  • Vocational qualifications at AQF level 4. or above
  • Diploma in VET Practice
  • Vocational currency as demonstrated through a range of work and related experience
  • Registration with relevant professional bodies as required for the teaching discipline

A vocational qualifications at AQF level 5 and 6 would be highly desirable.

Crucial to your success will be your proven track record in the delivery of up to-date and engaging programs, learning materials and teaching delivery plans in a learning environment, that motivates and guides students to optimise their learning outcomes.

You are highly motivated, with exceptional communication skills, your personal style is flexible and collaborative and are a highly motivated individual with the ability to contribute to team capability and operate as part of a high performing team.

To be successful, you will have a demonstrated ability to identify potential challenges in a classroom environment and effectively resolve these. Proficiency in using learning management systems, such as Moodle, to create innovative and engaging learning experiences for learners would be advantageous.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

At Chisholm, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We know that diversity and inclusion helps us to attract, recruit, engage and retain a team of talented people. If you require specific support to apply for this position, please advise the recruiting manager whose contact details are listed in the advertisement. We will work with you to identify the best way to assist you.

How To Apply

Applications for this position closes on 9am Monday 1 October 2018

Applications Should Include
  • a covering letter
  • curriculum vitae
  • contact details of three (3) referees

Appointment to this position is subject to satisfactory completion of Safety Screening requirements including but not limited to:
  • valid Employee Working With Children Check
  • verification of unrestricted work rights in Australia, eg citizenship, passport or birth certificate
  • certified copies of qualifications

If you have any questions regarding the position or require further information please contact Grant Collis, Manager – Electrical on +61 03 9212 5137.

Chisholm Institute reserves the right to withdraw an advertised position at any stage.

Industry

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Higher Education
  • Education Management

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Training
]
